As an AI language model, I cannot predict future events, but I can tell you about the current trends and evolving technologies in biomedicine. 

One of the areas that are rapidly evolving in biomedicine is precision medicine. Precision medicine is an approach that involves understanding the genetic and environmental factors that contribute to a person's health and developing personalized treatments based on this information. This approach utilizes genomic data analysis, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics to develop personalized treatment plans. In the future, we may see more advancements in precision medicine that allow for even more tailored treatments tailored to an individual's unique genetic makeup.

Another rapidly evolving field is CRISPR technology, a revolutionary gene-editing tool that enables the insertion, deletion, or modification of DNA sequences in living cells. CRISPR technology offers new possibilities for treating genetic diseases and creating genetically modified organisms with desirable traits. As the technology becomes more refined, it may also be used to modify the human genome to cure previously untreatable diseases.

Artificial intelligence and machine learning are also rapidly advancing fields in biomedicine. With the huge amounts of data generated by medical research, machine learning algorithms can help identify patterns that were previously difficult or impossible to detect. Multiple applications like computer vision, natural language processing, and predictive modeling can contribute to improving medical research, diagnosis, treatment, and drug discovery.

Overall, the next big thing in biomedicine is likely to be a combination of these evolving technologies providing more comprehensive solutions for personalized treatments, gene editing, and medical research.
